title: Ticket #5811: After shared_port restart, endpoint should quickly check for addr.
description:
The function SharedPortEndpoint::RetryInitRemoteAddress() unconditionally waits for sixty seconds after it fails to find the shared port daemon's address file. Instead, on the initial startup and after each restart, we should try again after a (few) seconds(s) because with the exception of CCB, we're just waiting for the shared_port daemon to start and write out a file, which shouldn't take very long and unnecessarily delays start-up.

Doing so minimizes the window where the master will not have an address after the shared_port daemon crashes. (A faster restart of the shared port daemon may also be wise.)
